Mild sweet delicate toasted toffee chocolate cherry hint light body.  Clean mild hop smooth charcoal hint end.Delicate but tasty.  Sampled 12/31/2009.  $7.79 / 6-Pack.

Quick head.   Dark and translucent in the cup, with deep amber and garnet.   Light but penetrating aroma.  Crisp and slightly acid mouth feel,  tingly on the tongue with carbonation. Light bodied.  Smooth mild flavour, well balanced, with a long finish.

A nice basic beer.   Tastes like beer, smells like beer.

11.2 oz. Pours a clear light brown, darkening to a deep amber brown in the glass. Little head with very little retention. Very malty, slight roasted scent. Light sweet flavor, very little bitterness that appears at the end and stands out in an odd way. Seems kind of lacking though, not much body to the flavor. Medium carbonation and body on the tongue.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a dark, clear, amber brown with a thin white head and limited lacing.  Aroma is light chocolate/coffee malt with some sweet hoppy notes.  Flavor is light and crisp, hoppier than the aroma but with a decent chocaltey malt background.  Beer is a bit thin but enjoyable, a decent dunkel.

A: Medium golden brown color with a nice foamy head.

S: Tons of malt with a hint of caramel sweetness.

T: Typical german malty brew. Tons of malt up front with a hint of biscuity sweetness in the background. Not my cup of tea.

M: Medium bodied.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a light head that quickly dissipates. The aroma is not strong but there is a nutty, malty, coffee aroma. The taste is a little nutty too with coffee, roasted and it is a bit bitter, which I like. Overall though this is an average dark beer but enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours dark amber brown with minimal foam and little retention. Aroma is caramel, roasty, nuts. Tastes fairly sour and has a lively mouthfeel with a bitter finish.
Decent German dunkel that works well for parties or other gatherings.  Tends towards the lighter side.  Not very complex but then again, not every beer has to be.
In bottle; OK dark beer. Good color, subtle chocolate and coffee flavours. Seems quite mild; much better German dunkels available
Dark pour.  Malt, chocolate, coffee flavor.  Light body.  Long finish.  Not too bad.

pours out dark honey gold with a 2 finger thick beige head that was lumpy and frothy.  the body is deep maroon brown with a good amount of bubbles rising from the bottom center of the glass.  the aromas are faint but is biscuity with notes of dry grass or hay.  it is a little yeasty with some toffee notes.  the head fell slowly while producing decent lacing along the edges of the glass.  it is thin bodied and a little bubbly across the tongue.  i taste wheat, lightly roasted malts, a little sugar and a slight hints of chives.  the aftertaste is smooth and doesnt last that long or is overpowering.  very refreshing and a decent beer to enjoy on a hot summer day.

Draft at a local. Pours a medium, off white heaad, of poor duration, with minimal lacing, over a dark brown (SRM 30) clear body....nose is roasted malts with heavy cereal, bit of biscuit....taste is heavy light roasted malts with cereal, slight toffee, caramel....mouth feel is light to medium, carbonation high. This meets the style reasonably.

Pours a very dark brown with an almost white head. The aroma is roasty, chocolate, lightly hopped and very sweet. The flavor is nice, but a little watery. Light to medium bodied, and on the sweet side. Not the best dunkel, but pretty enjoyable.
TAP: brown pour, nice off-white head. Aroma is caramel and dark fruit, taste is malty, sweet, bread, hints of fruit. Tasty stuff.

Another German gem!  Had this in a can from the LCBO.  Dark brown with an almond head, aroma is of toffee, chocolate and malts.  Taste is a bit thin but it has lots of malt and some chocolate highlights.  Very nice beer although there are better examples of dunkel to be found.

bottle thanks to bhensonb.  poured a dark brown with a white-off white head.  aroma was caramel, grains, chocolate, and a touch of coffee.  flavor was coffee, dark roasts, and some coffee bitterness.  body was almost medium with almost high carbonation.

Poured from bottle into Summit glass.

Chestnut brown with moderate white head and nice lacing.

Aroma of cherry, caramel, plum and metallic bitterness.

Cherry, caramel, toast, and metal (although not bitter). Can’t find much else to say about it, which is why this is only average.

Low carbonation with a light almost watery body.

Decent but nothing special. Could use more body or more "something" to counter the average malt profile.
Red-brown, loose cola colored head that falls quickly. Aroma is metallic, caramel, toast, biscuit. Taste is sweet, but still some steel, caramel, light cocoa.

On tap @ Fins Rehoboth-Dark brown pour w/a moderate head. Sweet malt aroma. Flavors of roasted malt, Caramel, bread dough, & candied sugar w/a little spice. Smooth, easy drinking session brew, not real complex, but nice. Full malt finish.

So I had about a dozen different Dunkels fresh on tap in Germany but apparently I’ve never rated the style.  Instead of rating from memory I bought the most accessible one.  Pours a normal dark amber/brown color with a small off white head. Aroma shows fresh pilsner malts, light chocolate and crackers.  Very malty.  Flavor is smooth with just a hint of graham crackers. Very dry and light bodied, not a huge flavor packer.  I actually liked this style when I had it from the source.  This one doesn’t live up but it’s a style I could dig.
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a reddish brown color with a light tan head.  Primarily the aroma of roasted malts and bread.  Light to medium bodied.  Slight smoky flavor.  A tinge of bitterness on the end.
Bready Aroma. Slight head. Bready malt taste. Slightly sweet malts were balanced by a dry, but pleasant finish.
chewy malty flavor, very thin with a slight light roasty flavor. Overall very dissapointing. Only drink it if it is free and you need the rating. On tap from some lame-ass oktoberfest in Miami.
The aroma is somewhat sweet with hints of malts. The flavor is small but enjoyable, a little bit of dark chocolate and a little bitter, just a tad. Definilty on the lighter side of dunkels.

Picked up a case of mini’s at Sams’s club last fall.  Didn’t realize it was a dunkel. Now I have to find out what a dunkel is. Nice dark color, went down smooth watching Germany v Spain in the Euro’s with some Brats.

Bottle.  I didn’t think this was very good at all, I’m actually surprised the ratings are so high.  Not much flavor in it.  No real hops, no fruitiness...just grain and wheat for me.  Not really a fan.

Bottle onboard Lufthansa from Frankfurt to Malta.

Light yellow color and a rather faint odor of malt with a little yeast in the background.

Easy to drink with a typical taste of bread. Not that bitter, a little bit boring.
(bottle). Clear dark brown/ruby color.  Medium off white head. Light malt aroma. Light sweet malt (caramel/molasses) flavor. Avg duration. Smooth finish. Thin texture. Soft carbonation. Spare lacing.

Dark brown pour with a decent tan head that recedes to a bubbly ring. Aroma is roast malts and caramel. Taste is fairly bland, malts and very bready. Hint of caramel in the taste. Mouthfeel is creamy and spritzy all at once, but somehow I feel like something’s missing. Just OK to me.

Dark amber color with light tan head.  Aroma of caramel, honey and banana, quite light but still there and pleasant.  Lightly carbonated.  Bready caramel malt flavor.  Some wheat, or other grain, pokes through with spices interwoven.  Clean finish.

Deep clear brown pour with light tan head.  Nose is moderately roasted caramel/toffee malt.  The light spritzy mouthfeel reveals fairly decentcaramel and toffee malt sweetness and some light  hop bite in the finish.  Refreshing enough.
Not terrible but not fantastic. Lacks character could be more malty. Has a sweetness but more of a yellow beer sweetness. Weird.

Pours a deep brown with a tan head that quickly disapates into nothing.  Taste of malt without much depth.  

12 oz. bottle
Dark, but very clear pour with a white head.  Aroma has caramel and a little fruit.  Roasted flavor.  Aftertaste is semi-dry.

Pours transparent dark brown with a light tan head. Nice strong malty aroma, some nuttiness. Similar flavor, mostly roasted malt, a little caramel and a hint of sour raisins. Clean and light bodied, decent but nothing special.

500ml can, pours dark clear ruddy brown with bit of white head, active carbonation but not extreme. Smells lightly of darker malt. Taste toffee grapes caramel and raisin. Lingering late note of nicely dring hop and just a hint of acidity. Right on keel as a refreshing Dunkel and one of the more palatable of the major-brand German beers.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a large quickly vanishing off white head. It has a faint aroma of chocolate. Tastes of toffee, cookie and caramel with a hint of chocolate. I thought this was a pretty good but not great beer.

12oz bottle 8/30/09 &#40Binny’s Naperville&#41-Pours dark brown iwth some amber tints and a small off white head. Aroma of nothing. Taste of malt. This light bodied is almost as bad as their basic beer. Unimpressed but still decent to drink.
Watered down, not much flavor and not full bodied at all as the style demands. not terrible but pretty disappointing.
Same old WS watered down flavors we’ve gotten used to expecting.  Not great, not terrible.
330 ml bottle.  Not much aroma to speak of.  Dark brown with a nice head, which dissipates half way through the glass.  Flavor is boring.  Very unimpressed.

I really like this beer. Had in a 0.5 L can unfortunately, but none the less, this is a very tasty beer. Pour is dark brown with a thin white head. Aroma of nuts, roasted malts and caramel. Taste is overly malty and a hint of caramel nuttiness. Palate is moderate. Overall pretty good but not incredible.
Bottle.  Pours black with white head.  Not much going on.  Thin and bland.  A little disapointing.  I was expecting more.

12 ounce bottle from a Farm Fresh in Virginia Beach, VA. Pours a clear cola color with a thin head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is dark roasted malts, slightly grain, with faint dark fruit notes. Taste is roasted malts, raisin, caramel. Thin bodied,
Draft sampler at Bully’s Restaurant & Pub, Columbia, PA...reddish-brown color...light aroma of malts, caramel...flavor was much of the same, some musty earthiness...OK, but somewhat bland.
Decent dunkel.  Pours amber brown with medium tan head.  Sweet caramel toffee smell and similar flavor.  Try it out.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a clear, very deep reddish brown body with a finger-width, creamy, tan head that dissipates quickly and leaves a light lacing. Aroma is semi-sweet caramels and lots of fruits. Has a distinct lager yeast smell as well. Similar flavor. Slightly metallic and tastes like a lager with a more nutty, deeper caramel taste. Very sweet with lots of nuts and fruits as well. Just a light amount of chocolate and semi-bitter roast comes in at the end with plenty of sweet fruits and malts lingering in the aftertaste. Dry, light bodied, and just a touch of carbonation keeps this very smooth. Overall, can’t really complain about this one. Nothing exceptional at all, but tasty enough.
Bottle.  Previously described as weak coke.....that would be a fitting description.  A poor beer.

This won’t take long cause I’m going to get rid of this as fast as possible. Plain brown beer that looks closer to weak coke, large foam-up and a death just as quick - odd pink??? Must be the lights in here today. Dusty smelling malts, caramel and darker fruit, very mild tobacco and an odd stink. The taste is a touch sour, tonic wwater like, some carbonation and off flavoured biscuity malts. Dry, light bodied beer with no finish. A total waste of money.

Poured a dark amber beneath a creamy white head, pinky finger thick only.  Aroma was mostly malt, maybe with a wheat undertone, and taste was rather much the same.  Mouthfeel was rich and solid, and despite the aforementioned malt, the finish was not overly sweet.  A pretty nice beer, and I’m good for more.
Draft pitcher at Gustav’s, Dark clear pour. Caramel, biscuit on the nose. flavor is darker than I expected but still light on the tongue.
Dark brown pour with a white/light tan head. A bit of a bitter after taste, but overall a great beer.

Draught at Gustav’s. Dark brown pour with a solid white head. Aroma almost entirely caramel malt with some light nuttiness. Flavor has a bit of roastiness, but mostly just standard malt. Not bad, very sessionable at the very least.
Bottle.  Pours clear brown, with a massive head that fills the glass, and then some.   The aroma is minimal, with malt, caramel and alcohol.  Light and malty, typical of a German beer.

Overall Impression: 
I haven’t had this one in a while.  This is a decent beer, it’s typically German in style, and a good starter beer for non beer nuts who prefer a darker beer.

Very fizzy. After taste is not really there so leaves a very flat taste. Head forms very weak and disappears quickly. More like a soda. Color a pretty amber. 
Tastes very bready. smells...stinks for a beir. Nothing to get excited about. Not a great beer for me.

Surprisingly good macro dunkel. Brown amber with a tanned head. Nutty and brown malt accented aroma. Good ratio of munich and brown malt in the body lending a nice nuttiness atop a malty backing. Medium-bodied with a beery underpinning. Moderately dry and bitterish nut finish. Not bad at all. A respectable budget buy.

"What the hell I swear the cap on this beer has a slight pink hue to it, body reminds me of a glass of coke dark, dark brown almost black, the light pink cap had not bad retention. This aroma is horrible what I can only describe as sour yuck, mixed with barn dust also throw in some mild spice, I don’t like this aroma one bit. Taste seems fairly average but not really all that good but its not putrid like the smell, it’s mostly bready with some noticeable alcohol and I swear I taste a touch of vanilla. Mouth feel is crappy to soft thin and flat, that’s all I want to say about it. Overall this beer is disappointing smells like crap, taste ok and is easily forgettable. Done while playing cards with Nat, beercronic and Leah."
On tap.  I thought I had rated this, so I am lucky I took down some notes.  Color was darkish amber.  Flavor was chalky, roasted and bready.  I couldn’t pick up much aroma.  Better than expected.

I had this on tab at Zehnder’s family restaurant in Frankenmuth, MI. It poured a dark brown with tan head, although it was extra "heady" due to an improper pour by the inexperienced barkeep. Anywho, the aroma and flavor were nothing more than subtle, with the slightest bit of hop character on the finish. I would say a decent session brew, but nothing to write home about. I would honestly only get this again while visiting this little German Michigan town. Cheers!

It had a strange grape/wine aroma to it. I’m pretty sure I tasted some grape in there too, but besides that weird taste and aroma there wasn’t much else going on here. Not a bad beer, but pretty boring overall.

malty aroma, dark pour with a thick that recedes with good lacing.  Good carbonation bite at the first with a cola malt flavor with a bit of floral hops.  Finish is just a bit bitter from the hops to provide a nice balance.

Can. Pours nice dark brown, with a foamy white head that recedes into a fine lacing. Primarily a malt aroma, with a hint of Euro-style hops. Sweet maltiness, with some hops, nut, toastiness. A little hollow in the finish. Solid.
Tap at german springfest.  Kind of warm.  Dark brown body.  Incredibly sweet malty.Not terrible. Wasn’t bad for a hot day.
Dark brown body witha few red hues. Foamy tan head. Sweet, nutty lager aroma. Rather plain nutty soft malt flavor...it is what it is...

500 mL Can. Deep brown body with a foamy pale beige head that settles to a foamy ring lacing the sides. A very inviting aroma of rich sweet malts with a hint of treacle; it says "good beer!" with an astringent note about it that is likely coming from the hops. Rich dark malts make up most of the flavor with a syrupy innuendo, floral and nutty notes in the aftertaste, and a sweet dark malt finish. Gutes Bier!
On tap at West 50 in Nississauga, clear ambar colour with small tan head and lasting lace. Slight malty aroma and flavour.

Dark chestnut brown with a tan head.  Good aroma of roasted malt and nuts, taste is a bit watered down vs. the scent, but still has a nice smooth malty body.  Finishes pretty quick - not as much of a lingering aftertaste as you’d expect from a good Dunkel.
Dark brown with small egg shell head. Nose of malts, banana and nuts. Flavor is a bit of sweet malts, nuts, caramel...all with a slightly bitter finish. Enjoyable.
The beer that made me like dark beers. A very woody, natural dark flavor. I could drink this like I drink milk.

Bottle. Pours a copper brown with a light white head. Clean and Earthy aroma. Flavor , well water with a woody lightly roasted and metallic taste. A quick malty and metallic finish. An ok Dunkel but nothing premium about it.

 I will come back and re-rate this beer once I have a fresh-ish one. Pretty sure all  the ones I drank were skunk(drank them at a small bar in the middle of backwoods IL)
All That on top of the fact the bottles are not dark, there is no way that’s how they really tasted.

Clear, dark brown pour with a small, off-white head.  Smells nutty with toasted caramel, faint banana, and a little vegetal.  Flavor is toast, almond, hay, and a slight noble hop spice on the finish.  Thin body with lots of carbonation.

330ml Bottle:  Aroma of malts, nuts, vegetables, and cardboard.  Poured copper/brown in color with a small, off-white head that lasted around the edges.  Clear.  Lightly sparkling.  Flavor is slightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of malts, vegetables, nuts, dried leaves, and some caramel.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Nutty, malty finish is a bit cloying.
Bottle. Poured a darker brown color with no head at all. Aroma was some fruits and caramel. Flavor was roasted malts and caramel. Very thin and light body. Very drinkable.
very dark beer that pours with a weak head. aroma has hints of strong malts. palate tastes a little unbalanced with a rather oily consistency.

Draught at Old Town Tavern for the most random find of the year award.   A pleasingly creamy head tops a clear brown body and leaves light lace.   The aroma is subtle but has a nice malt and bread touch.   The flavor is sweet and has a kiss of hops in the finish.   Light bodied with prickly carbonation.   Lacks the rich malt flavors of my favorite dunkels, but it is still enjoyable.

Pours a dark brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma is toasted malts with notes of dark fruit and spice.  The flavor is malty and bready, but watered down.  This is a great everyday dunkle, but nothing special.
Dark, heavy, flavorful beer.  We have a beer club at work to sample a lot of different beers and this is the one beer that everyone loves.
Pours dark into a tan colored head. Goes down very smoothly and is not bitter despite being a lager. Has the aroma of hops with a hint of cinnamin.
Deep amber,small beige head.Slaty malt nose. Fatty salty light malt profile, good bead.

On tap. Sweet malty aroma. Dark reddish brown with a tiny head. Mostly sweet with a slight mild hop bitterness. Fairly light and crisp with a nice long aftertaste of malt. Not my favorite Dunkel but very good.

Worldmarket - Bottle.  Malty aroma, dark brown with white to yellow head, decent malty flavor hides most of hop flavors exept for aftertaste, palate and overall impression was okay.  My style prefernce is amber to light, this style seems a little sweeter and hot with alcohol.
Decent beer that has a poor following to it. Underachieving, as I had expected more.
Dark brown with big white head. Aroma: Malty with hints of caramel and citrus. Flavor: Malty taste with hints of roast.

Draft. Pours a dark red/brown color with a thin beigh head. Aroma is malty sweet with light roast, toasted grains and a touch of caramel. Flavor is lighly sweet with toasted malts, grains and some caramel sweetness with a thin to medium body  and a lightly bitter finish.

it poured dark red with a little head. aroma is just a little bit of dark smell, warm malty, kind of weak. the taste is like a little chocolate, malt, very nice slight sweetness level, and walnuts. tastes smooth and creamy with a dry finish. this one is nice and at the very back of the taste it still has that warsteiner yeast taste.. hahah i love warsteiner, this was very affordable and definitely worth it

Aroma is must and a little sweetness from the malts. Flavor is full on Dunkel - seems like a pretty standard representation of the style. Notes of nuttiness, wood and a little smoke. Very light in the hop department - but still a nice dry finish. Pours auburn/brown with white head.

11.2 oz bottle from home reserve, gift six. Poured a clear, brown/walnut color, with an off white, bubbly head that diminished to a small ring pretty fast, leaving some light lace. Malty and sweet nose with a little toast, bread, nuts, and caramel. The taste is as mellow as the aroma, with mild caramel, toast and nutty notes. Just some light hop bitterness. It is what it is. Light bodied and quaffable. Okay.
Bottle.  Poures a dark dark red/brown.  Smells nutty with a slight roast.  Tastes the same but ends some what watery.
Nutty start, slightly roasted, light and smooth, but alcohol appears unbalanced, beer ends with a water finish.
500 ml can, LCBO.  Pours copper brown.  Straight up grainy aroma.  Malty flavour with a touch of bitterness in the end.  Pretty decent.
Pours dark brown with slight red hues.  Aroma of malt and grain.  Taste of grain with slight sweetness to finish.
Aroma suave de malte. Coloração entre o café e o mate. Sabor pouco acentuado, com toques metálicos e discreto amragor.

Canette 500ml, courtoisie de Blankboy. De couleur rouge-noire foncée et claire. Nez de grains de malt aux notes rôties, léger de sucre et avec des notes fruitées (raisins) ainsi que des traces de toffee sucré. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et légèrement croustillant ainsi qu une texture aqueuse et aux faibles notes crémeuses.  Léger goût de grains de malt accompagné de petites notes fruitées (raisins) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute une goût de malt très légèrement rôti avec des notes de sucre, de pain ainsi que de faibles traces de toffee sucré et de chocolat puis en finale on retrouve de faibles notes herbeuses (foin) ainsi que des petites traces fumées. Post-goût court-moyen et aux notes sèches, léger de rôti et avec de faibles notes herbeuses.

slightly roasted and malty aroma.  pours a nice deep borwn with a thin light tan head.  nice malty flavor with a slight burnt toffee and rounded out with mild hoppiness that lingers on a bit in the finish...very tasty for this style.

Bottle.  Pours a dark brown with red hues and has a large tan head that slowly fades.  Taste is of roasted malt, caramel,  fruit and is slightly sweet.  The body is thin.  Similar aroma.  Very clean and easy to drink.  Not a bad beer, but it reminds me of Becks Dark, which is a bad thing.
aroma is very nice , appearance is dark brown/red with a nice 2" head , flavor kind of creamy / sweet nice coffee notes in as well, overall impression is not bad something i will would drink again

Bottle:  Dark brown with a finger of creamy beige head.  Aroma of lager malt and a little grain.  Tastes mildly sweet with maltiness.  Very light hop character and a faint roasted note.  More of a dark lager.  Unimpressive.

Bottle best by 04JUL09. Poured dark brown with a frothy tan head. Aromas of wheat, roasted malts and light spices. The flavor found some chocolate malt with a light hop background. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, sweet beginning with a light bitter ending.

10/4/08 On draught at Leavenworth Oktoberfest, Leavenworth, Wa. Aroma is sweet light roast forward with a background of soft fruity esters. Appearance is slightly hazy brown with a moderate maintained off-white head. Flavor is sweet roast with munich malt forward with a slightly fruity character and medium roasty bittering. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a medium carb textre. Overall, this is the classic example, but a little light on character.

Kind of a mahogany color with a small tan head that disappears quickly to leave a small head with very little lacing.
Smells like dark roasted malts and not a lot else.Taste is kind of dry with a sour carbonated bite. A carmel taste without any of the sweetness.Nothing special and definately not something I could drink more than one of.

Bottle.  Pours clear, rich-brown with a big one-finger head, good lacing.  Smells of apple and caramel.  Thin body.  Pleasant malty flavor, tastes much like the aroma.  A little mineral flavor compliments the sweetness.  A slight bitter aftertaste of noble-hops.  Very smooth, balanced, and drinkable.

I was surprised to see I had not rated this yet.  Anyways, pours clear straight brown color. Aroma of mainly toasted grain and wheat.  Flavor is a little light after such a big aroma.  Slight caramel sweetness and bread flavor.  Bit of a bitter finish.  Those hops surprised me a bit.  This is one of those beers you give to your friends who say they do not like dark beers.

Pours a clear dark mahogany with a small head that lingers as a cap for a while and leaves no lacing.  The aroma is nice with tons of roasted malts and a bit of smoke on top of a light breadiness.  The taste is not quite as full as the aroma with a sweet maltiness that flows into a grainy aftertaste with no hops to be found.  The smokiness is not as prominent as the aroma either.  The mouthfeel is thin with decent carbonation.  This is a decent session lager though with very little complexity.  Basic but drinkable.

Bottle pours a clear, mohogany color with a beige head.  Some lacing along the glass.  Sweet grain aroma. Flavor is light, sweet and malty followed by some nice roasted malt notes.  The finish is clean and it has a decent dry aftertaste.
bottle. has a very sweet aroma, wheaty aroma. pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. has a very plain yet easy to drink flavor. bit of a carmel aftertaste.
Opens to a loud dud.  Brown with a thin tan head.  Aroma of mild skunk, grain and toasted malt.  Taste of caramel and some mild dark malts but mostly tasteless and bland with a dry finish.
Typical German bland lager - just darker.  After I finished it, I couldn’t remember much of anything about it.

This is such an underrated beer.  I love it so much because it is a perfect cigar compliment.  It has the perfect mouthfeel for this style, better than any other I’ve had.  It has a long, smooth, easy going finish.  One of the beers you don’t have to think about.

Bottle from the LCBO
I thought i was going to like this one a bit more
A more detailed description will follow on a second tasting
I have misplaced my comments for this beer
canette de 500ml, bière brune foncée à la manière d’une münchener, nez éparse de lager blonde, en bouche rien d’étaonnant, pas de caractère, manque de rondeur.
About as watery as a beer gets.  Pretty much all malt, if you can call it that, cuz there’s hardly any malt in there.  Light as hell, transparent even though it’s a dunkel.

A very dark and moderately distinctive dunkel. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy and savory, with prominent roasted malts. Chocolate sweetness follows, rolling through hints of bitterness. When it finishes there is some skunkiness in the aftertaste, but not too much to complain about overall. A clean and refreshing beer that’s moderately heavy. I wouldn’t drink more than 3 of these at once.

Dark brown color...almost opaque.  Fluffy head, though it fades a bit fast.  Aroma of sweet malt, with just a hint of bitterness.  Slightly sweet malt flavor up front...very crisp, light mouthfeel.  Back is joined by a subtle hop bitterness, with somewhat of a sweet aftertaste.  Pretty basic dark pilsner...very easy drinking, while only possessing a slight complexity.

Draft @ Schmidts, Columbus German Village. A very sweet dunkel that reminded me of the least interesting Austrian example with its plummy notes, though the mineral side of this German rendition did seem out of place. After a few sip, it really tastes pretty much like raisin bread over which you’d throw a small amount of chocolate powder. Light-medium bodied, not so easy to drink as you may think. Fair, but I would not bother again.
Bottle.  very cola looking.  not bad at all. surpised i like it.  not a fan of war. pilsner but this was good.

Canned sample. Cola coloured, with medium carbonation. Aromas of minerals, stale malts, and a bit of lemon. Flavors are of whole wheat toast, a bit of roasted malt, and a bit of red apple. Farily dry finishing, albeit somewhat chemical-like. Not nearly roasty or flavorful enough.

Can (500ml). Pours a deep ruby-amber with a large frothy tan head. Aroma’s mild, sweet, sugary and fruity along with caramel malt and a hint of roastiness. Flavour’s watery but not bad at all: Very lightly roasted malt, sweet, some nuts and a light bitter finish. A bit of sourness in there too. Light to average bodied. Not bad, it’s easy to drink and a decent effort from these guys.

I really enjoyed this. Poured from a bottle. Once I took a look and examined it, it looked like a root beer. This was my first impression. Once I tried it, I thought, "Wow. Not bad at all". Very easy to drink and smooth with no strong, bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied, rather malty.

(Draft @ FS, HOU). Pours a very dark red-brown body, somewhat transparent. Big frothy off-wn. Funky spicy aroma, maltiness, dark fruit. Dark fruity musty taste, maybe like over-ripe bananas. Grapey. Malty. Fizzy. Good.
I like this one.  Its very light in taste for a darker beer.  Also, it is very malty.  I’m glad a found a bar that has something a little different so I know this will be my fall back there.
Pours mahogany into a shaker.  Coca cola head. Dark caramel aromas. Dry and crisp from front to back. Not much in the flavor department but not obtrusive.

<b>10-Sep-08</b> <i>(12-oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA)</i>  This beer pours a fleeting off-white head that looks rather stark sitting on top of a dark-brown body.  The aroma of toasted bread hits the nose, but also includes a fair amount of corn and a touch of metal as well.  The entry is malty, pleasantly toasty, gently roasty, and lightly sweet, but the flavors drop off quickly for a bland finish.  A slight sourness adds a balancing layer to the sweet, malty underbelly.  Hops are very light in flavor, noticeable only in the finish, and bitterness is appropriately light.  Medium in body with noticeable thinning in the finish.  Carbonation is moderate and somewhat prickly on the tongue.  The thin ring of foam leaves no lacing on the glass.  This is about what I expect from imported Warsteiner: an okay dunkel with characteristics suggesting mass production.  In a way, it is reminiscent of some Mexican dark beers, and that is a sad statement.  Drinkable but uninteresting, so not worth getting again.

rusty brown with a small white head.  malty aroma with some light roast.  flavor is pretty watery with some sweet syrupy toffee and and hint of nuts.  not really what i expect from a dunkel.  light bodied.

12 oz. bottle purchased at Total Wine in Kennesaw, Georgia. Best Before: Jan 23 09.

Appearance: Pours a clear, dark brown body with a thin, fizzy, but still slightly creamy off-white head.

Smell: Pale malts in the nose with supporting notes of spicy hops, stale nuts, and a very light vinous fruitiness.

Taste: Pale maltiness with light tastes of nutty molasses and honey. Very minor hints of apple and cherry fruitiness. Faint spicy hops and bitterness. A touch sour at times. Finishes relatively crisp.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium carbonation, though it’s a bit fizzy.

Drinkability: Never immensely flavorful or exciting, but it is quite drinkable, I’ll give it that much.
From a bottle poured a brown color with a fair amount of head.  Kind of watery malty flavor with a quick finish.

The only reason I bought this is cuz Beer magazine called this the beer of the month. Obviously they wuz smokin crack.
 This has a cross between a very mild chocolate malt and hints of skunk aroma. It is watery as hell and was almost drain pour.
Avoid at all costs. I’ll have to try to pawn these off to people I work with.
Nice malty aroma and flavor with a hint of chocolate. Thin bodied and a bit underwhelming. Pours a medium brown with a 2 finder off white head. Easy drinking session beer.

From a bottle--Poured a dark brown body with a frothy off-white head.  Faint malty grain aroma with a small hoppy spice.  Very smooth with hints of chocolate and sweet biscuits.  Nothing stands out about this beer, but sometimes you just want a mild dark brew like this.
If I had to drink one beer for the rest of my life, it would not be this one. Not to say its bad, I enjoyed this beer, but theres not too much to say about it honestly.
[1569-20080803] 500mL can. Tar-like dark malt aroma. Clear, dark dark brown body with quick bubbles. Mild malty grains flavour. Medium-full body. Drinkable and mildly boring.

Thick, creamy tan head that was slow to settle and left some nice looking lacing. Very dark brown. An extremely faint, almost rusty aroma-  not very attractive at all. Smooth, slightly malty flavor with a noticeably bitter finish and medium mouthfeel, but not very bold.

A nice looking beer, but not a very good beer. And far too light for a dunkel.

Pours dark brown with a frothy tan head that quickly dissappears.  Really looks like a glass of cola.  Aroma of caramel and roasted malts.  Rather thin body almost watery.  Sligtly biitter finish.  Drinkable but not exceptional.
Quite a good dunkel beer. Toasted malt,  caramel flaboured. Tasted bit bit watery and thin compared to others of this style. Very enjoyable though.
dark, filtered brown like coca-cola. Malty, some interesting spices, and some caramel flavor. Somewhat soapy mouthfeel. Pleasant overall.

Pours dark amber with light tan head. Lightly toasted malt aroma and faint hops. Flavor is mostly sweet caramel, toasted malts with mild hop bitternes and a slight metallic finish. Medium body with average carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.
Moldable beige head. Dark brown body. Grassy lager smell. Not much flavor. Pretty grainy. Malty, but the malts don’t taste like other dark beers. Metallic finish. A meh beer.

Cerveja dunkel - Coloração vinho escuro com espuma branco-gelo bem rala. Cheiro de cereais torrados. Cerveja com amargor predominante, gaseificada e tons acidos. Um pouco densa e adocicada. Uma dunkel que não me agradou muito.

Pours a very dark brown, almost like a cola with a small off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt and grainy with some caramel notes. Flavor starts of grainy and a bit bland. Some of the better flavor comes towards the end with some sweetness balanced by some hop bitterness. Medium bodied. Not bad for a dunkel, but seems to mass produced to really stand out more

11.2 oz bottle. Pours reddish brown with creamy tan head. Aroma is caramel and roasted malts. Flavor is of caramel, toffee and roasted malts. My first dunkel so unsure what to expect. This was a little watery for my liking but with caramel and roasted malts it is enjoyable.

Taste 7/8. Have had this a dozen times. Looks: Brown to black body, with a small  off white foam. Aroma: Muted straw malt. Soft water. Taste: Warsteiner with a roasted straw presence. Mild hop cleans up after the stickiness and soft water. A little sweet.

Pour was medium dark with light tan head.  Aroma of light caramel and malt.  Flavor was watered down grain finishing lightly bitter and sweet.  Clean and refreshing but nothing special.  Won’t buy again.
nice & clean looks are deciving & this beer is lighter than it looks but flavors are nice & clean all way through

This was my first Dunkel I tried, having previously had Warsteiner’s Premium Verum.  The aroma was slight and of roasted malts.  When I drank this at home, it was straight out of the bottle, so I have little input on the appearance.  I liked the overall flavor.  It was mostly of roasted malts and a slight coffee.  However, I was expecting a slightly stronger roasted taste.  Nothing was wrong with the taste, though.  The texture was very smooth and drinkable, though a bit watery.  Overall an enjoyable beer but nothing spectacular.
Wow... I enjoy the Premium Verum but this is just awful. It looked pleasant as a dunkel should look but the taste was just far from pleasing. It was thin in body and the hop flavor was not good.
Pours very clear. Brown colour with tan head. Malty taste with sweet undertones. Quite enjoyable and very drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours a clear brown with minimal tan head and zero lacing.  Nose is caramel malts and nuts.  Taste reminds me of sweet tea you get in the south that’s a couple days old… sweet, but with some stale funk.  Medium mouth feel.  A little flat and dull.
Dark brown pour.  Pretty straightforward taste of malt and some coffee. Enjoyable but nothing special.

Bottle: Poured a deep clear brown color dunkel with a medium foamy head with average retention and no lacing. Aroma of light sweet caramel malt is pretty neutral. Taste is very bland with light caramel malt with not much character. Very bland and boring version of the style and not something I am about to buy again anytime soon.
On tap. Pours out a dark amber topped with a off white head. Aroma of sweetness and malt. Nice body of roast malt.
Not too impressed about anything in this beer. Glad I tried it though. Kinda a good malty charachter.
Warsteiner is a great tasting beer with a smooth delectable palate.  It also makes for a great looking beer once poured into a pint glass.

500 ml can from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass.



App.:  Fairly deep mahogany, clear, fair light tan head.
  
Aroma:  Light black coffee, lightly vinous and tart, a little wood, a touch of funk (hard to imagine), a bit of grain/cereal.
  
Palate:  Macro medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Cardboard up front (dang), a bit of medium-roasted malt, hints of caramel, a touch of wood; dry with almost no bitterness and a wee bit of caramel on the finish; lacking.



Nice colour but the nose and flavour don’t keep up.
bottle, small head with cola colored body, malty nose with bland vaguely caramel and sugar flavors, watery finish

Poured a solid dark chocolately color with little head.  Smelled rich of malt, maybe a little hops, but nothing entirely destict.  It tasted pretty good, but again, nothing too distict in the flavor.  It felt medium to almost thin my my mouth but was a pretty drinkable beer to go with the tacos I was having for dinner.

Congratulations to be a drinker of the Anheuser Buschs’, of Germany, Warsteiner’s, pour, not poor, excuse to a dunkel, which is actually their shitty pale lager now with darker color! Dark brown 1 inch tan head, medium malt aroma with sugar, and corn present. Empty bubble crap foam. Water mouthfeel. Lager sugar, corn taste, crap! Drink a beast light instead and save money. The name, VaarSchteiner, not Warsteiner, has nothing to do with quality brewing, and everything to do with mass production and profiteering. Yeah, yardpour people! Stop rating beer based on name people and start rating it on quality and tate. Any beer that has corn in it, and you can go fuck yourself!.

malty aroma ... dark brown black ... light nutty taste ... watery mouthfeel ... easy drinking ..... good choice when the alternatives are BMC ... clean crisp finish ... no major objections just a good middle of the road beer that is readily available
One of my favourites. Its easy drinking with a crisp gold appearance. Absolutely delightful and refreshing. Highly recomended amazing German beer.
Very nice ne, I thought it was going to be nasty and bitter, but it was somewhat sweet and creamy.

This was a good beer. It had all the fresh and uniquely German qualities of their regular beer, but a nice rich maltyness that made this my favorite of the two. Smooth tast, hints of tofee a satisfying but not hoppy biterness. All in All a good drink.
Pours a dark brown with a small offwhite head.  Aroma is mainly malt.  Flavor is mainly roasted malts with very litte hops. Not bad.

A dark brown, almost cola brown, definitely inviting. Aroma is strongly malty with a hint of caramel. Flavor is well-rounded, not complex but delicious and satisfying, malty with just a hint of hops and a whisper of sweetness. Rather smooth and pleasant.

I was genuinely surprised by this beer.  I am familiar with the Warsteiner name but had never tried this particular brew.  This one is great.  Pours a nice dark dark brown with an above average sized white head.  The aroma has a faint hint of caramel and a natural nuttiness.  The flavor is wonderfully bold.  I wasn’t expecting much from this, so perhaps that is why my opinion of this is much higher than anyone else’s.  Overall a great beer especially compared to other beers in its class.

Poured a hazy reddish brown with a large eggshell white head. The nose was of wheat, toffee, banana and a little skunkiness. The taste started with mild hops, bitter cocoa and toffee, while the end brought caramel and clove. The finish was sweet and slightly hoppy. The feel was medium, as was the carbonation. This one is worth drinking. It has a little more character than a lot of other macro beers, so give it shot if you get the opportunity.

Beautiful dark mahogany with a  small quickly disappearing eggshell white head. Lightly roasted nose with an additional aroma resembling saaz hops. Taste is of roastymalt, caramel and some hops. not much else. Moderately sweet, not much bitterness detedted in the aftertaste. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. No lacing or head retention. Overall drinkable buy not really special.

Draught @ Fox & Hound:  This one pours with a decent sized white head on it.  It doesn’t linger long.  There was no real lacing to it.  The color is a ruby-tinged brown.  The aroma was OK, although not too strong.  notes of molasses, caramel, maybe a hint of roastiness.  Slightly less than a medium body.  The taste was slightly sweet with notes of the caramel and molasses.  A hint of hops for balance.  Not very exciting, but very drinkable.

500ml can 

4.80% ABV 

I tried this beer on March 12, 2008 after purchasing from my local LCBO outlet.  The beer poured a dark translucent reddish-brown with a 1" head which disappeared quickly.  The first aromatic flavour that hit me was molasses.  There was also some sweet malt and cherry hints.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with ample carbonation.  The flavour was malty/grainy with some unplaceable sourness.  An alright beer.

Pours a deep brown with a thin, creamy head.  Sweet aroma with lots of honey and malt.  The flavor is very similar, with lots of sweetness and a strong honey flavor.  Mouthfeel is smooth, but a little watery and overly carbonated.  Not bad, but not something I’d go out of my way to buy again.

Deep dark brown pour with a healthy head that dissipates quickly.  Strong appearance accopmanied by an equally strong aroma.  Sweet and malty with caramel and molasses just slightly offset by hints of floral hops.  Definitely medium bodied, if not medium to full.  Smooth on the tongue, clear of any biting hoppiness.  Taste of roasted malt dominates with hints of sweet fruits but  overall very mild.
Nice beer for a mega brew.  Pours a creamy tah head.  Beer pours a nice brown color.  Good malty flavor and beer is well balanced.  Mouthfeel is a bit thin.  Decent brew.
Pours with a foamy, off-white head covering a brown body. Aroma is buttery with roast malts. Taste is salty, and malty-sweet with a fizzy mouthfeel.
Decent beer from a good German brewer. Aroma of malts and molasses. Malty, smoky taste with a dry finish. Decent session beer.

500 ml can
caramel malty nose. good brown pour, wattery body, and mouthfeel, slightly hoppy, but quite malt flavour, meh, run of the mill dark lager, i was really let down when i saw hop extract in the ingredients list.

330 ml, bb 20 Jun 08. Three finger head with a translucent ruby-chestnut body. Molasses and roasted corn aroma. Similar flavor with a touch of sourish yeast for a little complexity. Near-medium body is smooth, slightly chalky-dry, and a little tingly on the tongue. Fairly typical example of the style.

12 oz. brown bottle.  Poured out the color of brown shoe polish, with a minimal white head on it.  Aromas are of roasted malts, some yeastiness, and not much else.  I can barely detect a smattering of hops, but it is fleeting. Tastes are of malts, some coffee notes, yeast, and a slight, but quickly disappearing note of hops.  Slightly bitter tasting, but it’s more from the malts than the hops.  Mouth feel is smooth enough and the finish slightly bitter, but this is essentially a macro dunkel. Drinkable enough but not complex.
Clear dark brown  with a thick long lasting white head.  Very grainy aroma.  Smells almost like honey wheat bread.  Tastes like a hearty bread with some sweetness and hops.  Simple but good.
Good beer. I had this after tasting Hobgoblin and it didn’t quite match up but wasn’t too far. A dark and smokey taste, not as nutty or fruity. A good rich beer full of flavor.
Light aroma. Really rich color. Light body but with a nice malty flavor and slightly bitter after taste. Solid Dunkel that isn’t too difficult to find compared to other Dunkels.

draft at hennings.  poured dark brown with red outskirts.  speaking of skirts - this brew is kinda weak.  flavor had slight rusted metal taste, which could have been from the taps at hennings.  not much of an impression left.
Drank from bottle. Aroma was light and slightly malty. Flavor was good, balanced. Caramel hops with medium-bodied taste. Smooth. Good.

Bottle. 11.2 fl. oz. Very dark brown with a hint of red contrasted nicely by a very light colored head that quickly diminishes leaving what looks like cola. Fairly thin bodied with a watery texture.  Light, sweet malty aroma with a similarly nice flavor that goes down real easy. Leaves a nice bitter aftertaste. Nothing spectacular, but tasty nonetheless.

Single bottle from Total Wine in Jacksonville.  Pours a nice medium brown color with virtually no head to speak of.  Aroma is nice roasted malt.  Taste is also roasted, nice finish.  This is better than expected.
500mL can from the LCBO.  Pours a nice dark brown.  Plenty of sweet malt, only lightly hopped, not very bitter.  Decent as is, would be excellent if it weren’t a touch thin in the mouth.

Huh?  I don’t understand the low scores with this one.  I loved it!

Beautiful clear dark amber coloring with good carbonation, this brew is eminently drinkable.  Very dark and malty, it’s a touch sweet but not overly so and could easily be a common session brew for me.  I even detect a little coffee in this one.
sweet burnt caramel aroma. Looks exactly like a glass of coke. Very light, but nice flavor, sweet if anything. I enjoyed this light dark beer.

Bottle. Dark copper colour with mostly diminishing white head. Nice hoppy and malty aroma with a hint of smoke. Flavor somewhat weak. Runs a little watery on the palate. Average finish. Certainly not the best o dunkels - but rather nice though.

Pours clear brown with a smallish off white head.  Aroma is malty, mainly pale malt with a lttle roasted malt in the nose as well.  Taste is fairly light but the same.  Not a bad beer, but a little light on the flavor side.
0.33l - Brown liquid under tan head, aroma of dark bread, smoky and nutty palate.  Good.
Sample @ Hallandale beer fest (bottle). Thin-looking dunkel with wimpy head. Bland sweetish aromas and caramel flavors. A little salty but finish is actually clean and it’s not bad.
12oz bottle: pours dark brown with a quick dissipating off white head, aroma of slighty sweet roasted malt, flavor has some roased malt some caramel and a slight bit of chocolate. not a bad beer.

A good beer...and a good value for its price.  It poured smith with a medium-lage head, and was a very deep brown.  The aroma was that of slightly sweet malt and maybe some hints of honey.  Flavor was much the same...the consistency was a bit thinner than expected, but it finished very clean.  It won’t knock your socks off, and there are certainly better German dunkels, but this is by no means a bad brew.

This is a very tasty dunkel. Aroma of roasted malt and hint of bitter coffee. Pour was beautiful. Deep dark brown with a puffy 1 finger off white/tan head. Taste was nice and light but with a strong roasted malt flavor. A hint of toffee in the aftertaste that leaves a bitterness after the swallow. Easy to drink and delicious. I may use this as a beer to convert BMC drinkers.

bottle. aroma of malts and hops. dark amber color with a very small off white head. tastes very yeasty and hoppy. kind of malty but not really. really has a watery aftertaste that I don’t care for. not real sure about what a Dunkel is to taste like so maybe it’s watery? this brew is ok. it had great lacing and looked great but the taste is thin and boring. so far I’m not too big on Warsteiner but I’ve only had two.

pours dark brown with a two finger fluffy brown head. aroma is toasted caramel malt with a little hops. has a light to medium body with good lacing and carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma but more toasted malt than caramel. the flavor is also a bit stronger with some grass and hay. as it warms the aroma catches up to the flavor ratings wise. not bad i guess.

Warsteiner Dunkel. Where do I begin? I bought it once by accident; but as the great Bob Ross would have said, it was a "happy accident". I’ve had the pleasure of drinking this dunkel in both bottles and on tap. Needless to say it is best on tap. It has a rich full body and a nice dark hue to it. A friend of mine’s father is head of a local german heritage club here in Youngstown, and he believed so much in this beer that he fought tooth and nail with the council to approve this be sold there. The council was against it because it is a relatively new brewery, but after tasting it they could not deny that it deserved a place. This beer goes down silky-smooth and sits well in the stomach. One of the best dunkels you can purchase in the states; definately worth the price.

12 oz bottle.  Pours very dark brown, thin off-white head immediately fell to a thin ring.  Very little aroma, but what was there was chocolate-like.  Thin body, sweet with dry finish.  Muted taste of chocolate malt, little bitterness.  Overall perception is a "clean dark lager" as stated.  Very drinkable, but no real "wow" factor.

Just your basic excellent German dunkel, nothing exotic or extraneous, even the commercial description is simple six word sentence.  But it’s hard to improve on what is said, "a...clean dark lager"
Yep, that covers it.  Excellent session beer, you could do much worse.

330ml bottle. 

Pours a clear cola brown with a medium sized tan head that fades slowly. Smells very sweet and slightly earthy. Reminiscent of a cheap pilsener. The flavour starts off watery and malty then mellows out to a doughy biscuit taste laced with slight notes of earth and chocolate. Light bodied and a little watery with a sticky finish that brings you in for another sip. This beer has it’s high points.

I picked this one up in one of those make your own six packs. I had very low expectations, because the regular warsteiner that I tried once was not very good. This one however proved to be a decent beer. It’s dark, but surprisingly smooth. Not one of my top beers, but a solid one nonetheless.
Poured to an not-so-dark beer that had a off white head. Aromas of malts and yeast. Initial flavor of malts and wheat. Finished with slightly sweet roast taste. Not a bad beer.

Poured from a 330ml bottle and served in a Bell’s dimpled mug.  This beer poured a dark brown with some faint ruby highlights.  A thick, foamy tan head slowly faded away, leaving a fair amount of lacing.  The aroma of the beer was made up of biscuit, toasted caramel, and roasted nuts.  The flavor included sweet, toasted malts, nuts, mild caramel, and bread.  The mouthfeel was light to medium-bodied with adequate carbonation and quick, clean finish.  Not bad, but not all that interesting either.

On draft this is a great beer. easy to drink , nice full flavor & NO aftertaste.Not uncommon for me to go to the waldhorn & drink many 42 oz glasses of this one. Always good& always reliable.
 In the bottle as long as its fresh, 4.1
its the best ive tasted simply that one of the best, the best ive chosen, it was a ver nice flavor and mouthtaste

Had this after a very long, nauseating car ride. Very smooth. Lighter than I was expecting and bitter. Great on the first couple drinks, but as I went further  there was a taste of copper which I couldn’t shake.
(German) Dark Amber Beer, with a Wonderful  appearance!!!  Roast smell with Med-Head. very nice finish, Highly recommended.

absolutely beautiful beer. a dark amber color with a beige head. I couldn’t stop holding it up to the light to look through it. smells nicely of caramelized malts. drinks very smooth and feels almost delicate in your mouth. flavor isn’t quite as effective as the appearance, but nice, just nothing special. long bitter finish. nice lace too.

Pours reddish black with a little head that goes away quickly. Aroma is malty, caramel malt and hint of chocolate. Taste is light and malty with hints of chocolate. Finishes lighter than most dunkels, very drinkable. I am not a huge fan of Warsteiner, but i would drink more of this.

Poured somewhere between dark copper and brown.  The head was white to off-white and was one-finger tall.  Quickly dissipating, it left no lacing.  The aroma was mild chocolate, sweet malt and even a bit of grape soda.  The flavor was light chocolate, roasted, nutty malt and again a tiny bit of that grape soda.  The mouthfeel was actually nice and the finish was clean.  Drinkable if unremarkable.

Dark in apperance with lighter tan head that dsiappears quickly. Thin bodied, not a heavy beer. Malty with mild hops. Any noticable flavor would be nuts. Not an extraordinary beer by any means. The Germans can do much better!

Poured a thin spiral galaxy of white foam over a cola-black medium-bodied dunkel.  Aromas of straw and faint ginger.  Tastes mildly malty and feels lightly carbonated.  Good with a meal, but not necessarily great alone.

500ml can, dark brown color, with a beige head, toasty, biscuity malt nose, with some toffeeish and caramelized accents, hint of chestnut nuttiness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a toasted, caramelized malt, cookie dough character, with an earthy grainy note, with a subtle coffee accent, a faint nutty and fruity flavor, leading towards a malty, lingering hop bitterness finish.

A friend of mine had a fridge full of these over Christmas and I partook in a few. Color me impressed. Pours dark nutty-brown with a nice dark tan head. Smells of light-roast and rye bread. Has a nice strong malt flavor that I can only describe by calling thick. The mouthfeel is pretty medium but something about the flavor makes it feel chewy in a nice sort of way. Overall this is a quality offering.

Bottle pours with almost no head,   Nice unusual deep chestnut hue.  Smells of old socks.  Tastes better than old socks, but with much room for improvement.  Starts off nice and mellow with subdued sweet malt and some herbal flavors.  Finishes vegetal with some tin and yeast = unpleasant.  Can’t really recommend this at all, for once I prefer the blond lager.

For some reason, this is way better than the regular Pilsner version. I know that it’s dark and therefore it should be more flavorable but still the difference is amazing. I really enjoy this beer and would recommend it on tap in particular.

0.5l can. Dark, transparent brown with no head. Kind of looks like a cola, actually. Smells strongly of malt and hops. Tastes strongly of malt, with notes of nuts.  Palate is smooth but the carbonation leaves your tongue tingling.

Bottle. Transparent brown with minimal head. Slight maltiness mixed with skunky lager aroma. Mildly malty flavor, with balanced hops. I agree that there is not much in the way of distinct flavors here. Refreshing but nothing special.

Bottle. Easy to drink. Dark beer with light flavor especially for dunkel. Find the warsteiner flavor interesting: not skunky but moving in that direction, easy to drink but defininative slightly malty nuttiness that sticks with you. Like it, but not much in the dunkel department.

Dark in appearance with lighter tan head that disappears quickly. Thin bodied, not a heavy beer. Malty with mild hops. Any noticeable flavor would be nuts. Not an extraordinary beer by any means. The Germans can do much better!

Jan. 2006 - Pour was obviously a very dark brown color, with smallish head. Roasted aroma was there, but not overwhelming. The most prominent feature of this beer was the very, very carbonated mouthfeel. Flavor was very mild, which I didn’t mind so much since I’m not a big dunkel fan. But I could see how a real German beer aficionado could be left wanting more.
Another great aroma beer that takes me back to Deauchland. Malty and cereal-ly, this stuff is really good as long as you like malt.
Not very carbonated, but an excellent flavor. Rich amber color, little to no head. Starts full-flavored and ends pleasantly fruity.

Clear mahogany with little off-white foam. Aroma reminds me of St Pauli Girl Dark...grassier than I expected and no roasty aroma present at first smell. Make no mistake though; it smells nice! The taste is unique: more tart than I was expecting and a little bitter. There is some candy sweetness present; maybe cocoa. It has that distinct St Pauli Girl flavor I always notice too...I’m thinking it must be a German lager aroma and flavor I’ve noticed rather than St Pauli Girl. All in all, Warsteiner Dunkel is decent, but give me a more robust and roasty dark lager anyday.
Bottle:  Dark Brown in color but not very thick.  Aroma was that of roasted caramel.  Flavor was smooth and easy with hints of chocolate, caramel, coffee malts.  I enjoyed this beer.
I love German creations.  This one is good.  Dark, tasty and drinkable.  Quality brew.
Thin and metallic.  A hint of some herbal notes, but basically brown macro swill.

Pours a clear brown with copper hue, beige head. Aroma of some sweet malt, some chocolate, and some dark roast. Flavor is very much the same. Mouthfeel is light-medium body, high carbonation. Overall, kinda light in the flavor depatment and somewhat watery, bu not half bad....Easy drinker.

Draft at Gustav’s, Portland, Or. Aroma of dark roasted malt. Deep brown color with a dissipating off-white head; medium body. Sharp carbonation. Noble hops match the malt. Pretty tasty. In the finish the malt tends to dominate, but the hops build and persist. Very good dunkle in a light sort of way. Nice bitter into the finish.

Brown/Ruby in color with small beige head. The aroma is a little sweet, notes of carmel and nuts. Herbal notes as well. Taste is medium sweet, soft, malty. Not bad, but not what I was looking for or expecting in a dunkel.

Can. Dark-brown appearance with minor translucency. Vague aroma of chocolate malt and a drop of molasses as the beverage warms. Quite drinkable and easygoing, with smooth chocolate flavour and light cream-coffee finish. A simple, enjoyable dark lager.

Canette de 500 ml acheté au LCBO d’Hawkesbury (Ontario), bu la même journée (12/12/07). Brune acajoux, pas de collet. Arome de malte légèrement torrifié, notes de patite fruits des champs. Goût de malte faiblement roti, un peu de réglisse. Pas trop impressionante!

330 mL bottle.  Dark mahogany brown with absolutely no head.  None.  Sweetish caramel malty aroma.  Taste is quite malty, and there may be a little malt in there.  Very mild on the hops.  Medium to thin body.  Disappointing.
Bottle. Pours a brown with a hue of red with fizzy head that was tan. Flavor was thin and watery with a light sweetness, maybe brown sugar. Palate was a bit to sharp with nothing to balance it out.
Watery palate, malty backbone. with undertones nothing to write home about....
A good but not great Dunkel.  Color was a solid deep reddish brown...  but very little head.  Aroma was OK...  a bit too smoky for me.  Taste was somewhat bland.  An OK beer.  I wouldn’t buy it again

On tap on a stall at The German Christmas Market in Birmingham. Dark brown to black with cream fizzed head. Boy did I have to search around this market to find something worth drinking, this was slightly thin and sweetish, but did have a sharp fruitiness that rescued the score. Blooming expensive though, I headed directly back to the pubs after this.
(Bottle) Pours a brown color with a fizzy head. Light malty aroma. Taste is of light caramel and toffee. A hint of nut as well. Thin mouthfeel. I am a fan of the style, but not really this one.
This wasn’t bad. My dad bought a 6 pack for me and we drank some. It was rather enjoyable especially with the food selection. It was some sort of grilled chicken if I remember.
Pours a deep dark brown. Cola color Quickly the tan foamy head disapears.Aroma of nuts and malt. Taste is a little watery. Nutty and very carbinated.
In a blind taste test I’d mistake this for a typical euro-pilsner or lager. Given the color I’d expect more body, but it’s kind of thin.
Better than I expected.  Lots of bubbles, which I like.  Bit of a metallic aftertaste.  Bit nutty.  Average
Slight nutty flavour, the carbonation was a little to great for me.  Not an overly complex beer, realativly straight forward dunkel

12 oz bottle.  A definite nuttiness to it.  However I was disappointed by the overall lack of flavor.  There is a slight savory, almost cheesy aftertaste.  All right for a cold autumn night I suppose.

What’s the beef with Warsteiner Dunkel? I thought it was a really tasty, complex beer. It was definitely better than what I was expecting: another boring dark lager of only slightly better quality than Amber Bock. We were picking up a lot of flavors from roasted nuts to apple. Of course, it did seem a little slight in terms of the body and palate. At any rate, I found nothing much to complain about. Warsteiner Dunkel (bottle) is a tasty, attractive beer at a reasonable price.

500 ml can. pours very dark red with a small of white head. aromas are weak with some roastyness coming through after it warmed. flavours are thin and forgetable. no real problems but nothing to rave about.

this is quite an acceptable brew indeed. it has a decently sweet toffee taste. it has acceptable body and is refreshing. the carbonation is good - foamy yet bubbly. the beer has a rye/barley quality that is simple honest and also carries a fruit type essence. the finish is is slightly bitter and flavorful (though a bit watery). extra point for being simple yet good! this beer is quite a looker deep brown with orange and red highlights.
Dark color, off-white head.  Sweet toffee malty taste, a bit too carbonated and watery.  Not bad, but prettty ordinary.

Pors a very dark bown with a head that discipates quickly.  The aorma was pretty good.  Reminded me a little but of hazlenut.  The flavor is allright but it doesn’t stick around in the mouth that long.  Tastes malty. Not a very exciting beer.  I drank this out of a lager glass.
Appears clear like cola, head remains; Aroma is similar to urine; flavor fades t metal; finishes with a straight bitter bite.  WORSTeiner.

Pours a dark caramel brown,with a small off white head.  Pretty clear.  Smells of some toasted malts, light dark fruit and caramel.  Nothing really inspiring here.  Maybe some berries and molasses as well.  The flavor is light bodied, with limited flavor.  Subtle dark fruits and caramel malts was really it.  Certainly could have used a little more body, maybe some more banana and fruitflavors to give it something.  Very underwhelming.

50cl can, 4.8% a/v

Pours cola brown with a nice tan head, densely formed. Nose is roasted grains and a slight hint at spice. Sweet, roasty tongue which could definetly use more hops. Mouthfeel was very watery, and the aftertaste was nothing special.

roasted grain aroma only a whisper, though it LOOKS like a respectable beer; fluffy pale tan head, dark clear umber hue. tastes like iron on the front of the tongue, mild sweetness and an absent hop balance.

500ml can into a tall German Lager glass. Pours a deep redish brown, just like cola, with a small light-brown head. Smells mostly of malts and sweet things. The taste is very big on sweet roasted malts, with some other sweet elements thrown in, I almost tasted some berries in there. It’s somewhat well rounded off by some bitterness in the finish, but I found that to be a little weak and inconsistent, though the roasty malt body is pretty tasty. Not a very big mouth-feel, with low to medium carbonation. Not bad over-all, I’m sure there’s plenty of better examples of this style, but I’m glad to see the LCBO seems to alomost be expanding their horizons. A good ’go-to’ beer as it’s always very well priced and well worth it.

Pours dark, cola brown, medium tan head. Fades fast.

Smell of malt & bread.

Tastes of malt, and a bit of a yeasty feel. Finishes a bit sweet, not bad.

Not the "biggest" dunkel I have had, but, not a bad session beer at all. Almost seems as if the flavors were tweaked back.

Pours a clear mahogany brown with a thin fizzy head. Aroma is the epitimy of grassy, with some sweet malt notes. Flavour has some caramel malt sweetness, with a nutty middle, pretty bland finish, and a thin watery mouthfeel hinder this beer.

500 ml can - pours a deep mahogany with a large but short-lived tan head.  Slightly metallic German hop character in the nose, with just a touch more caramel notes than the regular Warsteiner.  Flavour much the same, and the slightly sweeter quality derived from the darker malt is the only thing that sets this apart from a whole lot of Euro-lagers.  Serviceable, sessionable - yes, but is this a good example of the style?  I would say no, this is far too thin, and I would take the local and far tastier Denison’s dunkel over this anyday.

330mL bottle.  Deep brown color.  Khaki, foamy head.  Aroma of rich malts.  Sweet aroma followed by grassy hop scent.  Roasted malt flavor.  Very sweet toffee.  Watery body dominates the late hitting finish.  Not much bite... mostly sweet malts.  Could use more of a roasty malt body.  Forgetable.

Pint Mr B’s Clarkston - Aroma is mellow dark malts with a touch of hop bitterness.  Pours thin black with a small head and decent lacing.  Flavor matches aroma.  Palate is thin.  Nothing special, but better than BMC.

On tap at Redlefsen’s in Bristol RI. Right off the bat i was amazed how much better this was than the pilsner. But i think its just  preference in styles for me. A very dark nut color. Slight caramel aroma, sweet initial taste, and then maltier finish. Easy to drink i enjoyed it a lot after having some lighter beers first.
Good deep bark brown color.  Aroma slightly floral.  Flavor sharp, fresh hops.  Mouthfeel is full and round.  Worth another taste.

12oz bottle-pours a thin creamy tan head and dark amber/red color.  Aroma is medium malt-some sweet, Euro lager skunk, grassy.  Taste is light/medium malt-some sweet, Euro lager skunky, grassy-hops, fruit.  On the light side of medium body.  Ok effervescence.
Curious weak aroma of unroasted malts. Brown color, thin tan head. Wonderfully strong taste of roasted oats and barley. Clean finish.

Bottle.  Pours a dark ruby with a bone-white head.  Coffee malt and some hops in the nose.  The flavor is flat and non-complex.  A very light roasted nut flavor.  The finish is weak roasted malts.  This beer is drinkable but with its weak flavor I don’t know why anyone would want to.

Aroma is a sweet lightly roasted malt scent.  Color is a deep bright amber with very good carbonation and a nice head.  Taste light, crisp and bitter.  Starting with a light body it goes down crisp with a light roasted flavor.  Finish comes on with bland malt bitterness backed by a very light roasted taste. It is lacking in flavor and the first couple of drinks are not too good.
A bit watery.  Not what I expected for a dark.  light on body and thin on taste.

Interesting aroma, almost a sugary Guinness, with a sweet aftertaste to it. The beer looks inviting enough, but the product isn’t something I’d be willing to try again. Also of note: a slight nuttiness to its taste, whch only comes out after taking a few sips.

Also, the guy who posts above me is queer.

Bottle. Looks identical to coke when poured, same head and everything, even the lacing. Aroma is odd, like cold spinach. and stale Highlife. Flavor is malty, with the slightest hint of raisins, like it’s trying to be a doppelbock. Standard sort of hazelnuttiness you get out of most brown beers. Finishes a little sticky, but the back end nuttiness is good. Body is way to this for the flavor; this feels like malt liquor. Disappointing, as I actually like the verum. Aroma does get better (brown sugar) as it warms.

On tap. Pours a dark brown color with almost no head. Watery thin apperance. Aroma of smoked nuts and charcoal. Taste is of weak, burnt old coffee with slight malt under tone. Pretty bland and boring.
What I noticed most about this was the roasted flavors of the malt.  It had a strong roasted twang that was not unpleasant.  The hops are understated, deliciously hinted at.

From bottle : A clear dark brown head that forms quickly.  Sweet malts and coffee domanate the aroma.  A malty taste with no apparant bitterness.  Palate is medium bodied, smooth down the hatch.  Its ok.
This is a very smooth dark beer. Good drinking beer.  A good way to start drinking darker beers

Bottle. Pours a nice rich brown with amber highlights. Lots of grain and noble hop notes on the nose. Flavor was fairly light with some roasted malt and hops. Medium to light bodied with good carboantion. Simple but nice.

Bottled, BB 3/1/08.  Poured clear reddish iced tea brown with a creamy cap of beige head.  The aroma picked up very sweet cocoa and darker bready notes with a light roast to it.. soft, sweet, and simple overall.  Flavor had lightly-roasted and very sweet chocolate and caramel at the core with very light woody bitterness and a mild sour kick extending outward (in a good way).. long, sweet finish.  Lighter-bodied with a nice flow to it.. good use of dry roast provided a refreshing finish.  Not bad at all.

Name: Dunkel

Date: 11/23/1995

Mode: Draft

Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs



ii+ to ii
dark amber, thin head, nice lace, slight malt aroma, sweet malty flavor with a sharp tangy malty aftertaste

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Dunkel

Date: 02/28/2002

Words: Draft

Words: Wild Wing Cafe

Words: Marietta



Dark brown with ruby highlights, thin whispy head, light sweet malt aroma, thin body, malty flavor, low hop flavor and bitterness

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Dunkel

Date: 10/26/2002

Words: ss



dark ruby, whispy head, odorless, clean bitter chocolate flavor

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Dunkel

Date: 03/18/2007

Mode: bottle

Source: tasting

Score: 2.5 to 3.2



sweet dark caramel aroma with a touch of chocolate, big body, lots of sweet caramel and chocolate flavor, 



Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20

Rating: 3.2/5.0
Drinkability: 8/10

Score: **/4
Bottle - Poured Dark Amber, not alot of aroma. chocolate coffee taste, not much bitterness. Would buy this one again.

On draft. Nice dark brown colored beer with no head. Aroma of sweet chocolatey malt and a little roastiness. Mostly sweet and malty with a touch of roast. It has the slightest crisp finish. I liked this one alot.
Bottle. Poured a dark brown and amber color with frothy off-white head that quickly dissiplates. Tastes of roasted malts, coffee, and a sweet herbalness that cleanses the palate. Great beer.

Aroma was roasty and coffee like.  Average carbonation, the head lasted till about 1/3 of  the way into drinking.  Flavor as almost a bittersweet chocolate with a touch of a sweet aftertaste.  Overall I thought it a nice dark beer worthy of more.
Bottle.  Poured medium brown with thin lasting head. malty aroma;  Clean medium body with mild bitterness.  Light aftertaste with a bit of bittersweet chocolate.

Dark maroon pour with almost no head.  Smell was skunky, medicinal band aid and was more than likely really bad.  Taste was plastic like, malt, and medicinal.  Complete drain pour on this one, and one of the worst I’ve had.  Surprised this one was spoiled...
11.2oz bottle, pours a nice brownish color with medium offwhite head, smells of malt, caramel, roasted, sweet, light chocolate. pretty decent smooth taste, i’d have it again.
33 cl bottle, Fargo. Deep amber/caramel colour. Sweet malt and caramel aroma. Smooth sweet flavor, light aftertaste of chocolate. Better than I expected.
draft at sarah’s in toronto.  amber hue with beige head, it has caramel aroma that is sweet and fruity.  the flavor is chocolatey, full bodied and malty.
i tried this last night and actually enjoyed it a lot. i’ll have to find some more of it so i can have some at home to drink.
Nice dark color, aroma is malt and chocolate. Taste is rich and malty but not too sweet with a slight friut flavor in the finish. Quite good.
bottle thanks to Marty RB.  Dark brown in color, small tan head.  Aroma is light chocolate, and light caramel malts.  Taste is light chocolate, relatively smooth with caramel in the back.  not bad.

Bottle... beautiful dark brown color with a head that is initally light brown but turns off white. Nice aroma, but not as penetrating as the Verum. A smooth flavor that reminds me of a watered down version of Guinness. Not a bad beer, but I like the Verum MUCH better. This is too smooth for my taste. I like a beer that has a stronger character with a bitter finish.
To me this smelled just like a plain old beer.  I really did not care for the taste either.  After reading the other reviews I think I may try it again just to see.
Smoothest Dunkel I have yet found.  Rich, yet smooth.  Mahogany-coloredwith a slightly hoppy aroma.  Long lasting, smooth finish.  My favorite.  Exceptional on tap, but hard to find.
Easy to drink alot of.  Smooth with medium body.  Malty with a subtle chocolate hint.  I rate it as good.  Very sessionable.

A light brown head about 1/2 in thick. Coffee, malt and a hint of molasses and earth whiff at your nose. The color is a dark brown with tints of red. The is an initial fmoderate sweetness. The finish is some what long with coffee and molasses and a hint of earth. There is however a slight hint of citrus on the end which makes it  a little bit astringent. It is good beer overall and easy to drink. The body of the beer seems to be light and moderate. The texture is syurpy carbonation flat

Bottle. Pours a brown color with a small off white head that diminshes quickly. The aroma is light hops with hints of caramel. The taste is very smooth with a sweet clean finish. I enjoyed this one and am looking forward to having it on tap.

Mahagony brown with a clingy off-tan head.  Aromas of roasted malts, a little smoke, and medium caramel.  Grabby up front on the palate.  Good carbonation.  Very dry finish.  Woody, roasted, slightly citric flavors.  Finishes clean.
12 oz bottle,nice beer.caramel, roasty, red, brown, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, I like beer.

On tap, poured into my 32 ounce/1 liter/whatever plastic souvenir mug at the annual Schuetzenfest festival put on by The Kolping Society, one of the many German heritage organizations in Greater Cincinnati.  Faint malt/cheap grain aroma, color of standard commercial coffee, light body, faint malt taste overcomes the rancid notes that are more prominent in Warsteiner "Premium" Verum.  Better than the "Premium" Verum but that’s hardly a ringing endorsement.  For some reason, Warsteiner brands seem to increasingly be the only ones on draft at the beverage booths at the German societies’ festivals.  Oh well, bring on the Germania Society’s Oktoberfest, where you can go to the clubhouse and get the same variety of beers the group’s members can.
On tap at the Oasis.    Nice smooth caramel flavor with hints of chocolate.  Worth trying repeatedly.

On tap at Flying Saucer Little Rock.  I’m not sure why this is getting such low ratings.  Maybe it’s better on draft?  Or maybe I have a different palate... Either way, this beer was incredibly smooth and fluffy.  Thick tan had on a dark carmel body.  Chocolate, raisins, clove, toasted malt, and some cola.

Bottle.  Pours a clear brown with a moderate off-white head.  Light but pleasant aroma of malt.  Flavor is also malt with a bit of sweetness followed up with some hops bitterness.   The flavor quickly dies, which is a bit surprising for a darker beer.  A tad thin.  Definitely better than lawn mower beer, but not quite what I would call a good session beer either.

THOUGHTS: I used to love this beer and while I still like it, it doesn’t even compare to Penn Dark, which I tried the same night. But it will still be one of my favorite session beer. It is a good beer that at least in NJ is very affordable. PA prives for it are more than double. One of the first imports or speciality beers I bought on a regular basis. Just a little too much mustiness underlying in the aroma and flavor keep it from being great, and that might just be from travel.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a meium brown with orange highlights and a small to average, white head that mostly diminished but left fair lacing. The aroma was light to moderate hay, strw and carmel malts with moderate to heavy grassy hops and moderate doughy yeast. The initial flavor is light to moderate sweetness and light bitterness, while the finish is heavily sweet and moderately bitter and sour with an average duration. The gody is light to medium with a watery, yet dry texture fizzy carbonation and slightly chalky, lightly astringent finish.
Coloração preta avermelhada, creme bege não persistente. Levemente tostada, tanto no aroma quanto no sabor. Carbonatação média.
Beer pours a brown ale color with notes of malt on the nose.  It gives you a clean flavor with some stornger notes of hops but yet drinks quite clean.

Not quite as strong or bitter tasting as I thought it would be, especially for a darker beer. Although a good beer,  I’m not sure it merits the almost 10 dollars per 6 bottles (for some reason the 12 pack is only a couple of bucks more, but hard to find).  Overall a tasty delight.
Uhhh not much here.  Pours out like flat coca cola with no head.  araom was somewhat malty and a little sweet.  flavor was extremly thin.  I was very disappointed in this brew.
draft: clear reddish brown, not much for any retention. Aroma is nutty with notes of caramel. Somewhat sweet finish with a light body. Clean tasting, but lacks any real complexity.
