Looked good, a solid brown slightly cloudy color. Taste was very lagerish, and the sweetness was well balanced. Other than that, this beer was not that good. Above a lot of weak lagers, but no andechser.
This is a light bodied dunkel and pours with a light smalll head.  This is beer just does not have the complexity for me.
Nice-looking reddish brown beer. Lighter nutty aroma. Malty flavor. Relatively thin. Enjoyable.
Good dark beer.  I think I still like the Premium Verum better, but this one is nothing to laugh at.

not much of a head, a great dark beer though.  lacks the coffee flavor most dark brews have, and thats what i find appealing about this one.  although i do like the coffee flavor, its good to find a dark that doesnt have it.  this beer is good out of a bottle, and even better on tap.  great effort

Dusky appearance with a fair sized head.  Not much of a nose; a little woody/nutty.  Smooth, light bodied  malt taste with a touch of sweetness.  Lacks complexity.  A middle-of-the-road dunkle from a brewery that could do better.

deep cherry wood or mahogany color. decent head with big fat bubbles, but pretty short-lived..leaves a nice ring though and a tiny bit of lacing..moderate carbonation. aroma is of mildly smoky malts (reminiscent, to me, of a smoked turkey at thanksgiving). flavor has a slight smoky quality to it and a hair of nuttiness as well....not at all bad.
Dark amber-brown color. Nutty malt aroma. Flavor is almost all malt and little else. Lacks complexity. Syrupy palate and a flat body. Disappointing.
Light brown color. Hensfood aroma. Vinegar feel, both in aroma and flavor. Really bad one...

Brown with an ok head.
A sour, vinegar aroma.
Not much flavour at all, but rather smooth.

The beer has a great flavor.  Nutty with a hint of roasted nuts (barley) that is pungent to the nose.  Very smooth and is the best with real german meat loaf.  Nice dark color similiar to the bocks that I drink.
Delicate but big malt flavour. Perfect bitterness for balance. A delicate hop bouquet is evident not only in the aroma but also in the flavour.

6/21/03, draft, Berlin.  Thick, dark brown brew with a large, creamy, tan head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma of peat, smoked malts, hops and brown bread.  Flavor is rich roasted malts, earth, assertive hops and an astringent finish.  Full bodied with an immediate mouthburst of carbonation.
Light in body and flavor. Sweet, nutty, toasty, light caramel malts. Even though I'm not a dunkel fan this is someway below my favorite dunkel.
On draft. Nice and edgy for a dunkel. Stands up well to a plate of wurst. Mahogany red in color. Very fruity in nose and flavor.
Dark, malty, the hops and nose taste had hints of a pils (what some might call skunky, but it definitely wasn't in this beer.) A pretty good brew, plain but very drinkable.

Deep mahogony color and clear with a tan rapidly diminishing head.  Hint of hopps in nose but primarily malty.  Tast is malty.  Medium bodied with a refreshing taste.  Not a bad beer and to make it that much better I got it for Father's Day.  Decent summertime brew, possible repurchase.

Thin, dark body, little head. Aroma is fruity and sweet--grapes and plums. Malt body starts sweet, a touch sugary with very light notes of caramel. Finishes lightly bitter. A bit thin and bland overall but has some character.

Dark brown and clear. Not the strongest head. A little watery at first, but carbonation and texture seemed to improve as I drank. Interesting aroma. Nice and roasty with sweet black licorice notes. Surprisingly refreshing and clean and rather easy to drink.

Rerate Cola brown appearance, slight off-white head. slight caramel aroma and matching taste. Smooth mouthfeel, decent. Original 3.5 Had this on draft at the Mellow Mushroom in Chattanooga. Has a pleasant malty aroma - ruby red dark appearance. Good malty flavor. Stays strong to the finish - has a good thick mouthfeel to it.

The beer looks better than it tastes.  Beautiful clear chestnut brown.  Small but persistent off-white head.  Smells like caramel, with a hint of chocolate and a tang I can't quite place.  Unremarkable mouthfeel.  The taste is surprisingly bland, a faint bitterness from the roasted barley, quickly overcome by sweetness.  Not as good as the Verum.
Appearance is a darkish/red. Flavor is clean with a slight sourness and a distinctive yeastiness. Some bitterness but not very full bodied. This is not bad for a mass produced European beer.

This brew poured a medium white head that was quick to dissolve. There was not a lot of lacing on the sides of my mug. It had a dark brown body. Bitterness was definintely noticed in this drink. I was not very impressed with this brew.
Dark like root beer, with a foamy pour.  Very little aroma of any kind save malt.  Taste of burned chocolate.  Overrated.

Dark brown, slightly translucent. Smallish, foamy head. Pretty good lacing. Malty, slightly grainy aroma, maybe a touch of cardboard. A bit watery on the palate. Some slight coffee notes. Clean finsih with a touch of hops.

This brew poured a dark transparent brown body with a small head of white bubbles. It had a malty aroma as well as an initially bitter taste that lingered around for a while. Its lacing was good, but overall not one of the better Dunkels. Pass.

It's been years since I had the Warsteiner Premium Verum, which I very much dislike, so I enter this beer with both hope and fairly low expectations.  This beer starts off a fairly nice dark reddish amber with a quickly fading light tan head.  The aroma is NOT impressive.  Kind of a stinky mix of yeast and wheat...not overly pleasant.  The flavor is alright.  It's fairly thin and doesn't last on the tongue at all.  Decent, though, while it lasts.

Medium brown color. Medium head. Aroma is malty. A medium bodied dunkel. Malts are slightly roasted and a touch chocolaty. Hops are mild spicy. Well balanced. Smooth. Light and refreshing. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
I really like this Dunkel, smooth and strong, slightly malty with good clean aftertaste.
I've enjoyed every dunkel I've had, and this beer is no different.  I couldn't get too much aroma out of this, but what was there was agreeable.  Very smooth going down with some bitterness.

Solid beer, not outstanding but much better than other German darks.  Like it says, clean dark light bodied lager.  No heavy aftertaste, slightly malty, roasted malts come through as it warms.  Some bitterness, not much in the aftertaste.  Pretty close to the textbook definition of a dunkel.

On tap at the Warsteiner tasting at Eli Cannon's on April 24th, 2003.  Dark brownish black, with a red hue through the light.  Puffy almond head that quickly dimishes, but most likely because of the burger I was eating at the time.  Smells mildly roasty and light, with a crisp clean lager-ish quality.  Flavor is light and roasty.  Very clean, well done.  Aftertaste is very mild, leaving little flavor to be wanting more, but still a very good pint.  I'd take another.
Very nice beer. Had it on tap last night at The Newportville Inn (north of Phila). Great rich,dark color and nice finish.
Light malt aroma, light sweet flavor, weak mouthfeel, dark color, nothing about this would make me want to drink it again.
Has a brown color with some carbonation and a roasted malt smell.  Taste is of roasted malts and finshes with a nice bitterness.  Overall a very good dark German beer.
Light brown - poured with a small short head. I got way too much sweetness in this, almost like someone added high fructose corn syrup.  Not horrible, but not all that great either.
Chestnut brown; light nutty caramel aroma; nutty palate, good soft malt character.  Sweetish, touch sugary...simple, relatively light but enjoyable.
Pours a dark reddish brown with a thin white head. Flavor is roasty and malty. Slight caramel and chocolate malts are noticable. Very smooth and easy to drink.

Draft version. Colour is a dark ruby-brown with on off-white head that leaves some nice lace. Aroma is very mild with a hint of malt. Mouthfeel is creamy, but on the thin side. Flavour holds sweet caramel malt with some light hop bitterness in the background as it finishes. Pleasant, but nothing special.

Smooth with a medium feel and roasty malt flavor over all.  Nice body.  Malt in the nose, but not much else.  In a session, with a meal, very good.  Unremarkable overall.  Quality but without distinction.  Props for being easy to find.

This one pours a clear, dark brown color with a small, tan, rapidly dissipating head. It has very light toasty, malty aroma. Light bodied and light flavored as well, it is slightly malty, with a clean finish and just a bit of lingering sweetness. There is nothing spectacular about this one, but it is not bad and fairly drinkable.
Descent dark.  Nothing too special here.  Some spicy bock-like notes, thin body.  A little tastier to me than the standard Verum.
Some interesting herbal (tobacco) notes, a fair but sweet malt backbone, but basically boring fare.
Dark brown, decent head.  Very thin, weak mouthfeel - I was immediately disappointed when it hit my tongue.  The dark malts were nice.  Drinkable but unremarkable.
I actually liked this a lot, and I'm not sure why.  Easy to drink dark beer.  Worth the $2 pint.

This should have been bottled in a green bottle.  Perhaps it was just my experience with it, but it was way too sour and skunky tasting.  I would not mind trying it again, and hopefully have a better experience.
Dark with little head.  Nice clean and moderately rich in flavor.  A great slightly above average bar beer.

(3Jan2002--12oz. bottle) I barely have anything written down for this one, so it was not particularly memorable.
A bock-like beer.  Effervescent. Sour.
Notes of baking soda.
Watery. Just a standard dark beer. Not much more to say.....................

Decent but nothing special. The taste does not quite live up to the smell, though. Has an odd grainy bitter taste that I can''t quite place. Very light bodied and not quite as "chewy" as other dunkels I''ve had. Watery, underflavored finish. A little caustic?
Not a terribly different taste from the regular version.  A very faint dark flavor, not strong at all.

Mahogany, antique look that was nicely contrasting to superb head. Not to strong soft aroma of medium roasted malts, some sweet flowers were noticed as well. Taste - this beer was fairly light, a bit creamy, and overall very pleasant. It great to drink this kind of brew on any occasion because of its simplicity. Simple but great. This beer proves that one beer does not need to be overly complex to be great!
Candied aroma, and some fruit(cherry?) Ruby in colour, medium toffee head, with some lace. Mild treacle flavour, with the expected sweetness. Light bodied for a Dunkel, but tasty. Thanks Radek.

I actually thought this was pretty good, my expectations were low.  The color and appearance was dark cola like.  Flavor was light malt and slightly sweet.  Definately light for a Dunkel.  Went well with German food.
My favorite of the Warsteiners. Pretty light for a dark beer, but still maintains a ''darker'' taste.
Quite malty, sweet, with burnt vegetable aftertaste. Light bodied, dark color, tan head. Drinkable.
Medium head.  Light flavor.  Heavy on the malt and chocolate aroma.  Sweet, but not sugary.  Perhaps a little weak, but quite delicious.

Tap.  Light brown color with a bone colored, wispy head.  Light caramel and nutty aroma. Typical caramel flavor without a lot of malt depth.  Finishes quite dry and clean with only a bit of bitterness and light acidity.
An all around good beer with a nice dark color,malty aroma and taste with a slight bitter after taste that fades fast.Well worth another try at the store
Good lager nothing to write home about though...............................
A nice darker beer...it''s a serious lager, and it''s got a nice afteraste to it. Not much of a head on it, but good consistency.

They said I have to improve my ratings. Ok. The aroma of this beer is good. The appearance of this beer is good. The flavor of this beer is good. The palate of this beer is good. My overall impression is a positive one.

So there.

After a lovely cascade-like head effect, the head burns off and you''ve got yourself a malty lager, with a mild aroma and very few flavors of note.  The palate is especially disappointing, being a bit thicker than lager, but watery and dull.  Skip this one.
Orlando Beer Fest: Smooth, light bodied pleasant dark beer..................
A very light German Dunkel. Not bad for the price, but a very simple flavor on the palate.
man i like this stuf, nothing all that special about it but good brew.......

In the summer and fall, I can always find a safe and welcoming home for a good dunkel.  Warsteiner''s runs, I think, middle of the road.  Nice nutty flavors around the flavor profile ... but there was a distracting metallic flavor too.  Hopped a little more than I expected but that really wasn''t unpleasant.  Very grainy with hints of caramel.  Overall, this is decent dunkel.

It''s light bodied for a rich dark beer, full in flavor with a sweet and smooth taste.  It''s a beer to simply enjoy, where you don''t have to wrestle with the flavors to appreciate it.  
I''ve have had this beer a few times, and it seems to vary greatly by place.  I don''t know if it''s distributer differences or what, but when it''s good, it''s really good!

Here the trademark Warsteiner graininess works to better effect. While the body is a bit thin, the toasted flavors come out rather nicely to make for an enjoyable (though perhaps not thrilling) dunkel.
hmmm... can't really think of a good way to describe this.  kinda hoppy... a touch of dunkel...  eh

Nicely roasted malt body, which is light and smooth. I found the finish to have a noticeably sweat undertone similar to some of the lighter Maibocks. Deeply refreshing and highly recommended. This is a great beer for the buck.

Quite malty with a unusually dry finish compared with the becks dunkel version which happens to be quite sweet. Less hoppy than the becks dark, yet more robust with a more pronounced roasted malt flavor... nice, light body as well. Of all the grocery store dark brands, this is highly recommended.
Dark and mildly toasted flavor malty and different.  A nice change from the usual Warsteiner with the same high quality.

deep red with a thin head that dissapates quickly. Aroma of malts, roast and a crispness that is hidden in the back. Taste was unexpected with malts at first followed by a grainy sour/bitterness but not in a bad way. Very refreshing and recommendable.
good aroma and light body, good dark beer to enjoy on a hot day.............
Excellent beer with  agood body, great aroma, & wonderful full taste! Great with foods & a nice one to cool off with on a HOT day! A classic German brew!
A well rounded beer that goes well with beef.  A good buy for the price.....

Very nice malty arom and rich dark color made me very excited about this beer. The taste however didnt live up to my hopes. It had some good maltieness but was somewhat sour and all in all rather plain. A decent but far from spectacular beer.

Decent, Michelob Dark-style beer from Germany.  Actually this is what Mic Dark wants to be when it grows up.  Smooth, not overpoweringly heavy like dark beers.  It's a dark beer for wussy-dark beer drinkers like myself.
Looks and smells great.  If you don't like tobacco aftertaste, though, then avoid this beer like the plague.
This is by far my favorite beer! The well-roasted barleys and fresh hops each keep a distinct taste in this beer, giving it a very flavorful, mildly bitter experience. A definite must!

One night after plenty of beer pong involving a keg of labatt blue light and a 30 of keystone ice, after they ran out, we switched to the warsteiner mini keg.  Well it was better than the other beers thats for sure, and tasted great when i was wasted. A nice mix of malt and hops from what i can remember and not even too sweet. ill have to try again soon and rerate.
RERATE.  Tried again.  pleasant golden-brown beer.  It is a tad sugary, but still a lot less mild than I expected and dosent kill you with cheap malty taste.
A very straightforward beer.  Nothing exceptional about it.  Clear yellow color, some foam.  Has the same flavors most American Mega brews do, but is missing the aftertaste, which is a good thing.
Not very complex. Not very malty. In fact, not very flavourful. Not a favorite of mine. Still, better than all American, mass-produced lagers I have tried. If you want a German beer, try an Ayinger.
My favorite Beer.  It has a really nice roasted maltiness that I love.  ....
Good full bodied flavor with no ass kicking aftertaste. Good beer!..........
watery and rather thin.  It has more flavor than a regular lager, though.  Middle of the pack.
haven't drank to many dunkels but this was tasty. dark color and malty finish
Not a huge fan but its not too bad to drink. Drink with food................
I am not overly impressed by this beer, but I am not at all offended, either.  It has a solid, simple taste that hints at nuts and chocolate.  OK.
A very light German Dunkel.  Not bad for the price, but a very simple flavor on the palate.
Decent brew.  Very smooth, but not very complex.  Sweet malts in the taste, finish of burnt tobacco and brown sugar.  quaffable.
First impression... Nutty and somewhat roasty but not very complex. Dark brown with red hint. Smooth and fairly good finish. Excellent to use as a gulper.
i am not very impressed with this beer but it isn't really a bad beer either.  all i can say is it is a very dark beer with a decent head

This is supposed to be just like Isenbeck. Tastes great and would be a daily drinker if it was cheaper and more accessible.  Pretty damn good dark lager.

Re-rate: This one is not quite as good as I once thought. No complaints, a nice light bodied and refreshing beer that I will have again however nothing special.
I thought that it was pretty good.  It almost tasted like tootsie rolls I think or at least from what I remember.

quite disappointing. nice toasty aroma and dark color but  this was a very flat  and somewhat tasteless beer.
 not much to separate this from a bland lager except the color
Deep ruby red, biege head, fair lace. Nose is malt, the start malt sweet, the top is light, the finish is lightly hopped, dry, acidic, moderately carbonated, a good beer, but a bit "Lite" for me.

Let it be known that I have yet to meet a Dunkel that impressed.  This brew pours a dark brown with red highlights.  The average off-white creamy head has good lacing.  The light and clean fresh flowery aroma is primarily caramel malt.  The ultra-balanced flavor again is primarily caramel sweetness, with a decent long finish.  My only complain there is that it is bland and not complex.  The light to medium body is creamy with lively carbonation and a metallic finish.
Nice smooth texture - malty/swwet flavor with no bitterness.  Dark color with a slightly fruity aroma.  Pretty good - maybe a good session beer.

A decent beer (it's German, so I expect that at least) but lacking in complexity.  If you're looking for a very drinkable beer that isn't pilsener style, this is a good pick...otherwise, stick with something a bit more distinguished.
This one fell short of the mark.  It has a weak, almost watered down flavor and did not finish well.

decants darkish auburn brunette under a creamy disc of light  suds. head lasts approximately as long as death valley frost, but nothing unusual about that, aye? actually fuller aroma than i expected, fresh crust of wheat bread, damp raisins with a splash of rum. but then it's a bit too mild for the seasoned beer hawks that i know: a melted ice cube flat cola sweetness, moderately brisk, some hop. basically an honest formula, just needs to be boiled down to about twice the density.

Pretty good dark beer.  Nothing special about it, but its well balanced and smooth.  I like it.  One strange, cool thing about it is that when it warmed up, the aroma took on the strong air of apple cinnamon cookie dough, although it didn't taste like that.  Maybe its just me though...
Smooth drinking lager, decent flavor but horrible after-taste.  I tasted it well after it was finished.
Fresh bread nose, decent taste, nothing special.............................

For a Premium German Import, I was expecting a little more Actung Baby! This was mild to the point of being almost watery. What I could taste was good , but I won't buy it again. Light on hops, a little too sweet and malty. Not overwelming at all. Sorry Warsteiner.

Bottle (BB 04/08). Head is initially small, frothy, light brown, fully diminishing. Body is medium to dark brown. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, caramel, roasted nuts), lightly hoppy (herbs), with a light note of DMS. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Rather cookie-cutter and indistinctive.
had it on tap at a local bar.  Not a lot of hop taste.. more malty.  Was smooth and refreshing overall.
good taste - nice change.  Goes down supprisingly smooth for the dark color.
Didn't really care for this. It's average and for 5 bucks a pint, I think not! Aftertaste is a bit overwhelming.
This is not a bad beer by any means.  Much better than the premium pils.....

Rerate 10/06/03: Tried the draught version, and I'm not sure what I was talking about earlier. Light flavor, light body? Who knows. Dark reddish-brown with a thin beige head. The aroma is lightly nutty. It is light-bodied for a Dunkel, with notes of coffee and nuts. The finish is crisp which makes this a decent session beer overall. However it lacks any real character or complexity. 02/16/02 (3.4): Deceptively smooth-textured considering how dark it is. Since it is so light I would definitely choose over the Premium Verum. If it is going to be light it might as well taste good, and this one does. The aroma stood out a little more than the flavor, which I found to be very straight-forward.
This one is hard to describe.  There is almost no nose.  It goes down like water.  Very smooth.  I have never had this dark of a beer be so smooth.  Not much head, either.

So happy to find this in the French Quarter during Mardi Gras. There are actualyl quite a few places to grab some real brews here though I've seen some very old labels and it does it get pretty hot here during the summers -- it's good to look for signs of good storage if you do find a rarity here. Anyway, this one was black with off white foam, a small perfume nose, a light medium body effervescent body and medium bitter finish with roasty hues. Not bad!
this beer is damn good...I am a pretty big fan of it...I drank 8 liters the other night and didn't even feel bad the next morning...for me a true sign of a well brewed beer.
This is a good beer to me.  I like the dark beers.  Kinda expensive here in the states though.
An average German dark beer, okay taste and body, but nothing special.......

very good dunkel beer

very clean taste 
sits good on the palate

the flavor is not lacking like the light warsteiner

still a very good dark beer.

A cut above Beck’s Dark, but that is damning by faint praise. Little head, subdued taste, hardly roasted or burnt at all. You can do worse, but there are too many Schwarzes and Dunkels out there with more action happening to get too caught up in this one.
A decent everyday drinking beer comparable to Beck's Dark or Heineken Dark.  Among dunkels, though, I would lean toward Baltika Dark (a sleeper) or Ayinger Altbairisch Dunkel.
has a sharp dry malty flavor. ok to drink...................................
Average premium beer. Slightly malty........................................

I'd like to say some nice things about this beer, but to me there is nothing that stands out, other than a faint sour taste in the finish. Tastes stale, but the date on the bottle says it is good til July 02. I don't know but surely they can do better than this.
Pretty standard german dark beer.  It's nothing special but better than some.
Well it could be a great beer but it has that German import faint urine flavor.
very frothy head, but i'm afraid of the dark................................
Really good beer.  Has a good bite, and has about the same aftertaste as a heineken, although smoother.

Even though I don't rate to style, strange beers like this give me pause.  In a blind tasting I would never guess this was a dunkel nor do I think I could distinguish this from the same brewer's pale lager/pilsner.  Thus, I pause to worry whether they used dark malts at all in the brewing of this.  For me not even a hint of caramelized melanoidiny flavors.  Is it just caramel color added?  On its own merits, a mediocre beer.  Light somewhat adjuncty malts, a fizz of grassy hops near the finish, which is thin and near empty.  Forget it.

I swear this is Warsteiner Verum with caramel coloring added. If I were drinking this beer blindfolded I wouldn't think it was dark. No hint of Chocolate or even Caramel malt. Has that same earthy gypsum flavor as the regular Warsteiner. Must be from the water supply but whatever that flavor is, I don't like it. This is a very ordinary beer - not much different from Michelob Dark. Yawn.
Aroma was bad, not comproable to the complex taste.  Very dark but not heavy beer, with a nice taste.
Dunkel remind me a lot of brown ales, and this is no exception.  A fine black beer.
Sublime! Great beer with an increasingly large following by people who know good beer when they taste it (not one for pig swill drinkers)
Drinkable, not bad, but probably not something I will buy again.............
A very smooth beer.  I really enjoyed drinking it.  ........................
This is ok, but I wouldn't buy it again.....................................

Had this one tonight at Oktoberfest.  Of all the beers I had to choose from, I had 3 of these.  Very nice.  Almost a chocolatey hint to it.  I will definately seek this one out.
Re-rated because I just keep liking it more and more.
An okay dark beer.  Not the best out there not the worst....................
Descent brew but Kostritzer and Spaten Optimator beat it out................
kinda tasteless very flat, really cheap though,  wouldn't recommend this one, St. Pauli Girl Dark is far better.
good beer,i didnt think it had a taste for a while cuz i drank the first 2 after i brushed my teeth.this is a middle of the night kind of beer.
a very solid dunkel.  Not a bad price, and certainly drinkable.  I could drink a 12 pack in a night and be fine.
Yeasty and nutty: sums up taste, aftertaste, and aroma. Dark, coca-cola red with a starkly contrasting, white head.  Became roastier as it warmed, however nothing special here.
Ehhhh . . . never mind.  That's what I recommend.  Not much to it.  Particularly unimpressive in its lack of body.  Just not very interesting.

**Rating is for the draft beer.**
The light palate contrasts with this beers dark brown colour.  Not a let down, but nothing specatacular.
Quite tastey, not really spectacular, but a good all around beer. Worth a try if you like dark lagers.
Very enjoyable dark lager.  Nice light taste too.  I could drink this anytime.
This was a good solid beer. I enjoyed it. But it didn't have any great flavor or anything major memorable about it.
This is ok, but I wouldn't buy it again.....................................
Had this one tonight at Oktoberfest. Of all the beers I had to choose from, I had 3 of these. Very nice. Almost a chocolatey hint to it. I will definately seek this one out.…
An okay dark beer.  Not the best out there not the worst....................
Descent brew but Kostritzer and Spaten Optimator beat it out................
kinda tasteless very flat, really cheap though,  wouldn't recommend this one, St. Pauli Girl Dark is far better.
good beer,i didnt think it had a taste for a while cuz i drank the first 2 after i brushed my teeth.this is a middle of the night kind of beer.
a very solid dunkel.  Not a bad price, and certainly drinkable.  I could drink a 12 pack in a night and be fine.
Yeasty and nutty: sums up taste, aftertaste, and aroma. Dark, coca-cola red with a starkly contrasting, white head.  Became roastier as it warmed, however nothing special here.
Ehhhh . . . never mind.  That's what I recommend.  Not much to it.  Particularly unimpressive in its lack of body.  Just not very interesting.
**Rating is for the draft beer.** The light palate contrasts with this beers dark brown colour. Not a let down, but…
Quite tastey, not really spectacular, but a good all around beer. Worth a try if you like dark lagers.
Very enjoyable dark lager.  Nice light taste too.  I could drink this anytime.
This was a good solid beer. I enjoyed it. But it didn't have any great flavor or anything major memorable about it.
